message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the effects of melting glaciers. When glaciers melt, they can deposit heaps of sediment, which often includes large amounts of rocks and other particles. These deposited sediments can form crystalline solids. Option (A) is incorrect because ice cubes are not the result of melting glaciers. Option (B) is incorrect because penguins do not typically get confused or deposit in glaciers. Option (D) is incorrect because coral reefs are not directly related to melting glaciers.

This sediment can include a variety of materials, but typically it consists of rocks, sand, and other small particles. These materials form a type of deposit known as till or moraine. Option (A) is incorrect because the melting glacier does not produce ice cubes but rather deposits sediment. Option (B) is unrelated to the process of glacial melting. Option (C) is the correct answer because glaciers deposit crystalline solids in the form of sediments and rock material.
